result.execSummary:
The defendant Felix Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2, with credit for 2 days served.

miscConds.notes:
- As to Count 1 Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with firearms.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

- Complete Anger Management program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: -As to Count 2, the Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felix Hernandez

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Felix Hernandez in court with attorney Eduardo Maximo Borda.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez
 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to Count 1 and 2.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty of Count 1 and 2. Judgment of conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  

As to Count 1:

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 3 months at the House of Correction, concurrent with Count 2, with credit for 2 days served.


As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 2 months at the House of Correction, concurrent with Count 1.

 Court STAYED both sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Complete Anger Management program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- As to Count 1 Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
-As to Count 2, the Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and suecharges. 
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Defendant Felix Hernandez in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner for Attorney Eduardo Borda.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Received and filed:
Defense Motions in Limine and Jury Instructions received and filed.
State's Witness List.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 03/28/2016 at 08:30 a.m., in Branch 36.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Felix Hernandez in court with attorney Brian Hagner for attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Fred Svensson.
Case is calendared for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: AMM(DOB: 3-16-89);      JV(DOB: 1-18-11);              BV(DOB: 2/23/12)
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Felix Hernandez in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Felix Hernandez in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Spanish Interpreter sworn: Liesl Monroy.
Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.
Defense moves to dismiss complaint due to lack of probable cause. Arguments heard. Motion DENIED by the court.
State moves to amend the Scribner's error in probable cause section of the complaint.  Motion GRANTED by trhe court. 
2nd Paragraph - 3rd line in the probable cause section of the complaint is amended from "V" to "Victim."

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
